explanation: The report is not correct. The #else branch in create_response_object is excluded by the preprocessor because MHD_VERSION is defined as 0x01000100 (which makes the #if condition true). Code excluded by preprocessing is not part of the translation unit actually compiled and therefore cannot be considered "unreachable code" in the compiled project. MISRA Rule 2.1 concerns code present in the project’s compiled translation units that can never be executed; a mutually exclusive #if/#else where one side is not compiled does not produce unreachable code in that build. (If MHD_VERSION were different for another project configuration, the other branch would be compiled instead — still no unreachable code within a single compiled translation unit.)
